summary: This congressional bill, the Northeastern Arizona Indian Water Rights Settlement Act of 2025, aims to settle water rights claims for the Navajo Nation, Hopi Tribe, and San Juan Southern Paiute Tribe in Arizona. It ratifies a settlement agreement, allocates Colorado River water, authorizes water delivery contracts, and provides funding for infrastructure like the iiná bá – paa tuwaqat’si pipeline. The bill also addresses water storage, leasing, and exchange, and includes provisions for waivers, releases, and the establishment of trust funds. The bill also addresses an expansion of the Navajo-Gallup Water Supply Project to assist water delivery to areas in Arizona and addresses the creation of the San Juan Southern Paiute Reservation.
